text: Myriocolea irrorata is a species of liverworts in the Lejeuneaceae family. It is endemic to Ecuador. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. Since 2012 it has been transferred to the genus Colura. ==Sources== * Bryophyte Specialist Group 2000. Myriocolea irrorata. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 22 August 2007. Category:Lejeuneaceae Category:Flora of Ecuador Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Myriocolea irrorata
